lyrics.stanza: Recall how David swore, "I'll not come into my house, Nor go up to my bed, Give slumber to mine eyelids, Until I find a place for Thee, A place, O Lord, for Thee." Our mighty God desires a home Where all His own may come.

O Lord, against these days, Inspire some for Your building, Just as in Ezra's day— A remnant who are willing To come and work in Your house, Oh, what a blessed charge! Your heart's desire, is our desire— We come, O Lord, to build.
